academic bulletin 2024-2029: BUGEMA UNIVERSITY ACADEMIC BULLETIN 2024-2029 - This is the official academic guide for students admitted between 2024-2029. The bulletin contains academic policies, program requirements, university regulations, and graduation requirements. The last graduation under this
bulletin will be November 2028, after which it will be phased out. Students should refer to this bulletin throughout their academic journey at Bugema University.

academic calendar 2024-2025: FIRST SEMESTER: Aug 5 - Dec 13, 2024 (Classes: Aug 19; Registration closes Aug 28; Exams: Nov 25-Dec 13). CHRISTMAS BREAK: Dec 16, 2024 - Jan 5, 2025. SECOND SEMESTER: Jan 13 - May 16, 2025 (Classes: Jan 20; Exams: Apr 28-May 14). SUMMER SCHOOL: May 19 - July 16, 2025. G
raduation: Nov 8-10, 2024. Mid-semester breaks: Oct 7-11, 2024; Mar 17-21, 2025.

academic dishonesty: Bugema University prohibits all forms of academic dishonesty: PLAGIARISM (25% maximum allowed in research); CHEATING (copying, cheat sheets, impersonation); MISREPRESENTATION (fabricating sources); ACADEMIC MISCONDUCT (selling papers, changing grades, theft). Penalties apply as
per Examination Policy Handbook. Research papers/thesis must comply with 25% plagiarism policy.

academic grievances: Academic Grievances Resolution: 1. Try resolve with course instructor; 2. Head of Department; 3. Dean of School; 4. Senate if unresolved. All grievances should be resolved at lowest possible level.

academic probation: Academic Probation Policy: Warning - GPA below 2.00 in one semester; Probation/Suspension - GPA below 2.00 for two consecutive semesters (one academic year suspension); Termination - GPA below 2.00 after probation period.

adding dropping courses: Adding/Dropping Courses: Fill form from Registrar's Office; Get lecturer approval; Return form to Registrar's Office; Fee charged for changes. Deadlines: Adding - up to published 'Last day to enter any class'; Dropping - by deadline (no record); Dropping after deadline = F g
rade recorded.

admission requirements detailed: UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE: O-level with 5 passes including English; A-level with 2 principal passes or equivalent; HEAC with GPA 2.8+; Mature Entry Exam pass (age 25+); Relevant diploma. DIPLOMA PROGRAMS: O-level with 4 passes including English; A-level with 1 principal p

ass; HEAC with GPA 2.5+; Relevant certificate. HIGHER EDUCATION ACCESS CERTIFICATE: UACE with 2 subsidiary passes; Vocational qualifications level 2/3; Foreign qualifications equivalent. CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS: O-level with 4 passes; HEAC with GPA 2.0+. Note: Specific programs may have additional requ
irements.

application procedure: 1. Obtain application form from Registrar's office, liaison offices, or website (www.bugemouniv.ac.ug). 2. Fill form correctly and attach copies of academic certificates. 3. Pay application fee as stipulated. 4. Return documents to Registrar's office at least 3 weeks before ac
ademic year begins. Acceptance: You will receive acceptance letter if application is successful. Only come to university after receiving acceptance letter.

attendance policy: Attendance Policy: Required for all classes (lectures, tutorials, practicals). Excused absences: Illness, authorized trips, circumstances beyond control. Unexcused absences: Other reasons. Makeup work: Allowed for excused absences; Not allowed for unexcused absences. Excessive abs
ences: Exceeding 15% of contact hours may require dropping course. Tardiness: 5-10 minutes late 3 times = 1 absence; 15+ minutes late or missing 15+ minutes = absence.

auditing courses: Auditing Courses: Fill designated form from Registrar's Office; Pay 70% of fee per credit unit; May attend classes regularly; No quizzes or examinations; No credits or grades given; If credit desired later, must repeat course at another time.

bachelor of software engineering: The Bachelor of Software Engineering at Bugema University School of Science and Technology prepares students for careers in software development. The program includes courses in: Programming (Java, Python, C++), Web Development, Mobile App Development, Database Syst

ems, Software Design Patterns, Software Testing, Software Project Management, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, and Cloud Computing. Duration: 4 years (8 semesters). Career opportunities: Software Developer, Web Developer, Mobile App Developer, Software Tester, Systems Analyst, IT Consultant.

certificates transcripts collection: Certificate/Transcript Collection: Ready 1 month after graduation; Collect personally within 1 year; After 1 year: $2/month surcharge; Previous uncollected documents also charged; Safe custody at Registrar's Office: $1/month; Reprint/corrections handled by office
rs. Alternative collection: Legally registered spouse/sponsor/guardian; Or DHL delivery (preferred).

challenge examinations: Challenge Examinations: For students with prior knowledge of introductory courses. Restrictions: Not for failed/repeated courses; Maximum 6-8 credits through challenge exams. Procedure: Written request to Head of Department; Department presents to Senate; Approval letter sent
; Obtain form from Registrar; Pay 75% of course tuition fee; Take exam.

change of bulletin: Bulletin Change Policy: Academic bulletin valid for 5 years; After expiry, additional 5 years given for last cohort to graduate; Current bulletin 2024-2029 graduates last cohort November 2033. If bulletin changes while student enrolled, evaluation by Head of Department determines
course adaptations.

change of campus centre: Change Campus/Centre: Timing - Beginning of academic year; Procedure - Fill designated form from host campus, get department clearance, receive transfer letter and assessment sheet. Restrictions: Not allowed without proper procedure; Not allowed if remaining with one semeste
r; Only at end/beginning of academic year.

change of program department: Changing Program/Department: Acceptable with department heads and Registrar guidance. Requirements: Complete 18 credit hours (one semester) first; Check with current and new departments for qualifications; Obtain Change of Major/Program Form from Registrar's Office; App
ly for transfer.

computing and informatics programs: The Department of Computing and Informatics at Bugema University School of Science and Technology offers: 1. BSc Software Engineering - Focus on software development and engineering principles; 2. BSc Network Systems Administration - Focus on computer networks and

system administration; 3. B Business Computing - Business applications of computing; 4. B Library and Information Science - Information management; 5. B Information Technology - Broad IT skills; 6. Diploma in Computer Forensics; 7. Diploma in Information Technology; 8. Certificate in Information Te
chnology.

coursework assessment: Coursework (Continuous Assessment) = 50% of final grade. Components: Assignments, projects, presentations, quizzes, tests, mid-semester exams (combination depends on lecturer). Submission deadline: Within semester unless special arrangements. Late submission: Not accepted afte
r semester ends. Failed coursework: Cannot be supplemented after semester closes.

dead semester year: Dead Semester/Year: Student unable to continue classes for semester/year should submit application to Registrar through department, supported by sponsor communication. Failure to apply may require reapplication upon return.

erms student portal: ERMS (Educational Resource Management System): portal.bugemauniv.ac.ug. Uses: View results, register courses, check fees balance, download transcripts, access course materials. Login: Student number and password. Parents can access with student's ID and password to monitor progr
ess. Assessment sheet: Print once free; additional copies attract fee.

exam remarking: Exam Remarking Procedure: 1. Obtain Head of Department approval; 2. Pay required remarking fee; 3. Submit application to Head of Department. Script retention: Lecturers submit scripts to departments; Keep grade backups; Scripts may be destroyed after 3 years per Senate instruction.

examinations policy: Final Exams = 50% of grade. All students must take final exams. Failure to take exam = F grade. Special exams: Available for illness/emergency with DVC approval, fee payment, within 1 academic year. Exam periods: Last 2 weeks of semester; 2 sessions daily (9am-12pm, 2pm-5pm). Pr

erequisite: All fees must be paid or arrangements made. Rules: Bring exam pass & student ID; Sign attendance; No admission after 30 minutes; No borrowing; Only non-programmable calculators; No phones/electronic devices.

fees refund policy: Refund Policy: Applies to course load changes, withdrawal, dropout, expulsion, non-completion. Effective date: Date student notifies university or last class attended. Institutional Charges Refund: Week 1 - 80%; Week 2 - 70%; Weeks 3-4 - 60%; Week 5 - 50%; After Week 5 - 0%. Summ
er/Holiday Refund: First 2 class days - 80%; Next 4 days - 10% less each day; After 5 days - 0%.

financial matters general: General Financial Matters: University can withhold registration materials, results, transcripts, diplomas for unpaid amounts. Fees covered: Tuition, room/board, library fines, book costs, damages. Students responsible for breakage/damage costs. Personal effects should be i
nsured; University accepts no liability for loss/damage. Postdated cheques not accepted. Bounced cheques treated per bank/government regulations.

general education courses gec: General Education Courses (GEC): Required for all students. Seven areas: Religion, Health, Computer Skills, Writing Skills, Science/Math, Social Awareness, Vocational Studies. Requirement: At least one course in each area. Total credits: 21. Diploma/Certificate student
s: Required courses: Christian Beliefs, Health Principles, Fundamentals of Computer, Introduction to Writing Skills (13 credits).

gpa calculation: GPA Calculation Method: Multiply credits for each course by grade points, sum all, divide by total credits. Example: Course 1: A (5.00) × 3 credits = 15.00; Course 2: B (4.00) × 3 credits = 12.00; etc. Total points ÷ Total credits = GPA. Cumulative GPA determines degree classificati
on.

grading system: Grading Scale: 80-100% = A (5.00 GPA) Excellent; 75-79.99% = B+ (4.50) Above Average; 70-74.99% = B (4.00) Average; 65-69.99% = C+ (3.50) Below Average; 50-64.99% = C (3.00) Pass; 0-49.99% = D (2.00) Failure. Degree Classification: First Class = 4.40-5.00 (Summa cum laude); Second Cl
ass Upper = 3.60-4.39 (Magna cum laude); Second Class Lower = 2.80-3.59 (Cum laude).

graduation in absentia: Graduation in Absentia: Candidates must be present unless permission granted. Application: Submit written request to DVC - Academics at least 3 weeks before convocation; Include reason and fee; Permission only for obvious necessity. Procedure: Apply with genuine reasons; Must
fulfill all requirements including fee payment. Restriction: Not granted when student is on campus.

graduation requirements detailed: Graduation Requirements: 1. Complete all required course credits; 2. Clear all outstanding fees; 3. No disciplinary cases; 4. Apply through academic registry; 5. Minimum GPA requirements: Major - 2.25, Minor - 2.00, Cumulative - 2.00; 6. No grades below D accepted;
7. Complete major, minor, cognate (if required); 8. Complete General Education courses; 9. Submit transfer transcripts if applicable; 10. Clear all service departments.

higher education access certificate heac: HEAC (Higher Education Access Certificate): For students whose qualifications not equivalent to UACE. Categories: HEAC Humanities (Business/Arts/Theology); HEAC Physical Sciences (Computing/Technology); HEAC Biological Studies (Nursing/Agriculture/Health). A

dmission: UACE with 2 subsidiary passes; Vocational qualifications level 2/3; Foreign qualifications with 5 subjects minimum grade C. Program: 2 semesters, 40-44 credits. Required before degree/diploma if qualifications insufficient.

international students admission: International students may be admitted provisionally with comparable certification from their country. Documents needed: Valid passport, academic transcripts, student visa, medical insurance. Students from non-A-level systems (e.g., Kenya) must enroll for Higher Edu
cation Access Certificate (HEAC). International students should contact the international students office for assistance with accommodation and orientation.

internship industrial training: Internship/Industrial Training: Required for many programs (e.g., Agriculture - 2 months in second year summer). Purpose: Practical knowledge exposure, research skills enhancement, field expertise development. Industrial Training I & II courses (3 credits each) for so
me programs.

late fees charges: Late Fees: Continuing students reporting after normal registration charged late fee; Amount increases daily to maximum UGX 300,000; Purpose: Encourage early arrival and registration.

late registration policy: Late registration policy: Students with valid reasons can register late; A fee that increases daily is charged; Late registration officially closes at discretion of DVC Academic Affairs; Special cases (accidents, death in family) considered with consultation to ascertain if
coursework was done.

lost damaged documents replacement: Lost/Damaged Documents Replacement: Bugema University may issue duplicate original certificate with Senate action. Requirements: 1. Hand-written signed request letter; 2. Police report; 3. Affidavit from recognized firm/lawyer; 4. Payment for certificate reprint.

mature entry admission: Mature Entry Examination: For individuals who don't meet minimum requirements but have adequate knowledge (formal/informal). Requirements: Must be at least 25 years old; Must take exam from NCHE authorized centers only. This is an aptitude test that allows qualified mature st
udents to gain university admission.

program duration: Program Duration: Degree programs - 3-4 years (max 7 years); Diploma/Certificate - 2 years (max 5 years); HEAC - 1 year (2 semesters). Breaking residency: Less than 7 years - retain completed work if bulletin unchanged; 7+ years - forfeit previous work, re-admission required.

programs offered comprehensive: Comprehensive Programs Offered: AGRICULTURE: BSc Agriculture (Crop/Animal), BSc Agribusiness, BSc Environmental Science, BSc Food Technology. BUSINESS: BBA, BSc Accounting, BSc Finance, BA HRM, BA Economics, B Entrepreneurship, B Procurement, B Secretarial. EDUCATION:

BA/BSc with Education, Diplomas. HEALTH: B Nursing Science. SCIENCE/TECH: BSc Software Engineering, BSc Network Admin, B Business Computing, B Info Tech, BSc Statistics, BSc Biochemistry. SOCIAL SCIENCES: BA Development, BA Community Dev, BA Humanitarian, BA Journalism, B Public Admin, B Social Wor
k, BSc Psychology. THEOLOGY: B Theology, BA Religious Studies. Plus Diplomas & Certificates in all fields.

registration process detailed: Registration involves 4 steps: STEP 1 - BUSINESS OFFICE: Arrange financial payment, obtain financial clearance. STEP 2 - ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT: Obtain registration form, pay club fee, select courses with advisor, upload in ERMS, get chairperson approval. STEP 3 - DEAN OF

STUDENTS: Obtain residential status, register for BUSA, clear club obligations, submit BUSA receipt, collect Student Handbook. STEP 4 - REGISTRAR'S OFFICE: Complete registration details, obtain Registration Card, collect Academic Bulletin. Late registration available with daily increasing fee.

research project requirement: Research Project Requirement: All degree programs require independent research as capstone. Procedure: Present proposal, conduct research, write thesis/journal manuscript under supervisor guidance, present orally at seminar before panel. Research coordinator assigns men
tor/supervisor.

school of agricultural and applied sciences: School of Agricultural and Applied Sciences: Dean - Assoc. Prof. Paul Nampala, PhD. Philosophy: Science as study of God's handiwork to sustain mankind. Mission: Train holistic professionals in Agricultural Sciences and Rural Development. Vision: Center of

excellence in Research, Training, Community Engagement, Sustainable Innovations. Departments: Agricultural & Environmental Sciences; Nutrition, Food Science & Technology. Programs: BSc Agriculture (Crop/Animal Science), BSc Agribusiness Innovation & Management, BSc Environmental Science, BSc Food T
echnology & Human Nutrition, Diplomas, Certificates.

school of business: School of Business: Departments: Accounting & Finance; Management. Programs: BBA, BSc Accounting, BSc Finance & Banking, BA HRM, BA Economics, B Entrepreneurship, B Procurement & Supply Chain, B Secretarial Studies, Diplomas in related fields.

school of education: School of Education: Departments: Arts Education; Science Education; Institute of Professional Growth. Programs: BA with Education, BSc with Education, Diploma in Education (Primary/Secondary), various teaching subjects including Economics, Entrepreneurship, Business Studies, Ge
ography, History, Religious Education, Languages, Sciences, Agriculture, ICT.

school of health and allied sciences: School of Health and Allied Sciences: Department of Nursing and Midwifery. Programs: Bachelor of Nursing Science, Diploma in Nursing, Diploma in Nursing Extension, Certificate in Nursing.

school of science and technology: School of Science and Technology: Departments: Computing & Informatics; Life & Physical Sciences. Programs: BSc Software Engineering, BSc Network Systems Administration, B Business Computing, B Library & Information Science, B Information Technology, BSc Statistics,
BSc Biochemistry, Diplomas in Computer Forensics, IT, Science Lab Tech, Biomedical Engineering, Certificates.

school of social sciences: School of Social Sciences: Departments: Development & Humanitarian Studies; Public Administration & Management; Social Work. Programs: BA Development Studies, BA Community Development, BA Humanitarian Emergency Management, BA Journalism, BA Peace & Conflict Management, B P
ublic Administration, B Social Work, BSc Psychology & Counseling, Diplomas, Certificates.

school of theology and religious studies: School of Theology and Religious Studies: Departments: Theology; Religious Studies. Programs: B Theology, BA Religious Studies with Chaplaincy/Development/Evangelism/Urban Ministry options, Diploma in Theology, Certificate in Theology.

semester system: Bugema University operates a semester system: Each semester = 18 weeks (1 week registration + 15 weeks instruction + 2 weeks exams). Academic year = 2 regular semesters: 1st semester (mid-August to mid-December); 2nd semester (early January to early May). Credit units: 1 credit unit
= one 50-minute class per week for 15 weeks, OR 2 hours tutorial, OR 2-3 hours practical per week. Students expected to spend 2 hours preparation per class hour.

software engineering program: The Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering at Bugema University is a comprehensive program that focuses on designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software systems. The program covers software development methodologies, programming languages, database manag

ement, web development, mobile app development, software testing, and project management. Graduates become skilled software engineers capable of creating reliable, efficient, and scalable software solutions for various industries.

special grades: DG (Deferred Grade): For courses spanning multiple semesters; No GPA effect. I (Incomplete): For illness/emergency; Must clear within 1 year or becomes F. P (Pass): Pass/fail courses; No GPA contribution. CR (Credit Repeat): When repeating course for better grade; Former grade change
d to CR; No GPA contribution. EX (Exemptions): For transferable courses; No GPA calculation.

summer sessions: Summer session purpose: Industrial attachment/practicum. Course offerings: Some departments may offer courses during summer with Senate approval. Requirements: Minimum 5 students must enroll; Only full-time lecturers teach; Students must be in final semester with not more than 2 cou
rses (6 credits) remaining. Duration: Usually 6 weeks. Summer/holiday programs follow different refund schedule.

supplementary exams: Supplementary/Retake Exams: Allowed for students who failed final exam but scored minimum 25/50 in coursework. Procedure: Obtain request form from Registrar's Office, fill, supply copies to Business Office, department, Examination Office. Fee: Required. Maximum grade: D (plain).
Time limit: Failed course must be cleared within 1 academic year or must repeat course.

transfer credits: Transfer Credits Policy: Bugema University accepts credits from recognized universities. Procedure: Request previous institution to send transcripts directly to Bugema Registrar. Requirements: No grade below D+; Overall GPA ≥ 2.50; Minimum 15 upper division courses (45 credits) in
major taken at Bugema; Minimum 5 upper division courses (15 credits) in minor taken at Bugema; Transfer credits not accepted until completion of one semester at Bugema.

tuition fees payment: Tuition Payment: All fees must be paid before registration. Bank Accounts: Equity Bank (UGX: 1017200261563; KES: 1004203110057); Centenary Bank (UGX: 3100018764); UBA (UGX: 1206000016; Forex: 0113009891); Standard Chartered (Forex: 8702010609600). International Transfers: UBA (
SWIFT: UNAFUGKA) or Standard Chartered (SWIFT: SCBLUGKA). Present deposit slip to cashier within deposit month.

withdrawal from university: Withdrawal Procedure: 1. Obtain clearance form from Registrar's Office; 2. Fill form and obtain all required signatures; 3. Submit completed withdrawal form. Documents issued: Withdrawal letter with partial transcript of covered semester(s). Withdrawal only effective upon
form submission.

Onward,

Bugema!
O’er the valleys and the hills

History of Bugema University: Brief History:
1927: First Adventist educational institution in Nchwanga.
1948: Moved to Bugema (640 acres).
1950: Secondary education started.
1970: Junior college for pastors.
1974: Upgrade to 4-year seminary (BTh).
1994: Licensed as university.
2009: Granted Charter

by President Museveni.
2010: Launched Graduate School.
Currently offers Undergraduate, Graduate, and PhD programs.

Bugema University Philosophy: Philosophy: True education fosters the restoration of the lost image of God in human beings through the harmonious development of the physical, mental, social, and spiritual dimensions (Head, Heart, and Hand - 3H program).

Bugema University Vision Mission Motto: Vision: A Christian University of choice for Excellence in Education and Skilling.
Motto: Excellence in Service.
Mission: To offer an excellent and distinctive holistic Christian education designed to prepare students for productive lives of useful service to
God and Society with integrity, honesty, and loyalty.

Spiritual Life and Worship: Spiritual Life: Central to Bugema. Students expected to attend weekly Convocations (Tuesdays 10:00-11:00am) and other worship services.
Sabbath Observance: Observed from sunset Friday to sunset Saturday. A day of rest and worship. All students expected to respect the sacr

edness of the day.
Activities: Prayer bands, witnessing, Adventist Youth Society.
Student Food Services: Food Services: Cafeteria provides balanced vegetarian diet (included in boarding fees). No cooking allowed in rooms. Snack center available.

Student Housing Accommodation: Housing: Female students encouraged to live in on-campus residence halls (beds provided, bring mattress/bedding). Male students can live in approved private hostels near campus. Married housing not available. Room/board charged for vacation stay.

Student Code of Conduct: Code of Conduct: Upholds Christian principles. Prohibited: Illegal drugs, alcohol, tobacco, gambling, vulgar language, violence, immorality, public sexual intimacy, theft, unauthorized meetings. Dress code applies. Violation leads to disciplinary action.

E. W. Petersen Memorial Library: Library: Named after pioneer E. W. Petersen. Provides books, e-journals, internet access.

Sun-Thu: 7:30am-6:00pm, 7:30pm-10:00pm
Fri: 7:30am-12:00noon
Sat: 7:30pm-10:00pm
Services: Lending, Literature search, Photocopying, Binding.
